documents.title: Accessibility-2025 Program
documents.content:
Accessibility-2025 Program,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

,Accessibility-2025 Program,,,,,,,,,,Recent action Items,,,,,,

,Welcome! The Accessibility-2025 Program will enable HelloFresh Group to complete HelloTech Objective #4 and comply with the modern level of accessibility for our customers driven by The European Accessibility Act (EAA). The program has two goals:,,,,,,,,,,üîÑ,"Resolve 90% of the P1 issues identified through Cypress that break 11 WCAG rules and manual audits in WEB.
Deadline: December 31st.",,,,,

,1,"Reduce the number of ""important"" Accessibility issues in HelloFresh, GreenChef, and Factor by 90% in WEB experiences by 28 June 2025, and in Mobile experiences by 31 Dec 2025.",,,,,,,,,üîÑ,"Resolve 90% of the P0 issues identified through Cypress that break 4 WCAG rules and manual audits in REACT NATIVE.
Deadline: December 31st.",,,,,

,2,Establish accessibility standards to support future HelloTech product development,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

,,,,,,,,,,,Current P90 compliance,,,,,,source

,Background,,,,,,,,,,WEB,,,,MOBILE,,

,"The European Accessibility Act (EAA), which mandates that websites and mobile applications comply with WCAG 2.2 Level AA accessibility standards, will come into effect on June 28, 2025. The directive applies to all businesses in the EU, including HelloFresh. Non-compliance can result in penalties such as fines (ranging from 500‚Äì500k‚Ç¨) or, in some countries like Ireland, even prison sentences. Companies may also face legal action from disability advocacy groups.",,,,,,,,,,33%,,,,15%,,

,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

,"Remediating the risk of fines requires a company-wide collaboration, which is the background of launching this program. Apart from avoiding fines, improved Accessibility in our interfaces also gives us access to new potential customers (with disposable income) who previously may not have considered our product because they functionally were prevented from doing so. There is no calculated business case for the Group yet, but we plan to dig deeper into the opportunity in H2. The program will be driven by Foundations Alliance and involve all CFAs teams owning Front End TRE in mobile or web.",,,,,,,,,,2025 compliance target,,,,,,source

,,,,,,,,,,,WEB,,,,MOBILE,,

,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

,"Foundations Alliance made all Zest components compliant with EAA standards out of the box, however, this does not guarantee full compliance. To achieve full compliance by June 2025, all CFAs will review their journeys and modify them as needed. 

Foundations Alliance has provided the following inputs to enable CFAs to minimize their efforts:",,,,,,,,,,53%,,,,20%,,

, ‚òëÔ∏è,"Improved Zest Design System components for iOS, Android, Web, and React Native platforms to have complete compliance with accessibility guidelines.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

, ‚òëÔ∏è,Created and maintain solution-oriented Accessibility Guidelines.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

, ‚òëÔ∏è,"Align, Define and Report upon an Accessibility Compliance Score.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

, ‚òëÔ∏è,Automated the identification of code-driven accessibility issues based on the automated end-to-end UI Tests,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

, ‚òëÔ∏è,"Provided results of a 3rd-party Accessibility Audit for HelloFresh, GreenChef, and Factor brands across web and mobile platforms.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

, ‚òëÔ∏è,"Created and maintain a company-wide backlog of Accessibility issues to enable compliance tracking on an ongoing, daily basis",,,,,,,,,Upcoming milestones,,,,,,

,Communication channels,,,,,,,,,,,HERE,,,,,

,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

,"Main channel: #accessibility-program-25: program updates, e.g. milestones, timelines, guidelines, etc.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

,Teams channels:,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

,,#growth-accessibility-2025,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

,,accessibility-2025-tam,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

,,accessibility-2025-crm,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

### EMAIL: Bye for now
ID: 19b3609d12f2e978
From: Anna Bauhofer <abau@hellofresh.com>
----------------------------------------

After more than 8 years with HelloFresh, it‚Äôs time for my next chapter.



From being a working student in Finance, to a love-hate relationship with

Oracle and eventually moving into Product Management and Payments, I wanted

to say thank you to everyone who was part of this journey:



   - Global Finance for being such a great starting point and supporting my

   transition into Product

   - My Product leaders for the mentorship and everything I've learned from

   you

   - The whole Payments tribe for simply being the best team

   - The friends I've made and that I know will last way beyond these 8

   years



I‚Äôll stay in Berlin and would love to keep in contact - you can find me on

LinkedIn here <www.linkedin.com/in/anna-bauhofer-815195164>.

See you around üíö

Anna



-- 



*Anna Bauhofer*

### EMAIL: Incorrect AU Christmas Box (OTP) order count
ID: 19b33cb727b3919c
From: "'Tamas Szilagyi' via HelloFresh Critical" <critical@hellofresh.com>
----------------------------------------

Hi Team,



HFAU Christmas Box (XMB) sold via OTP is showing incorrect order numbers.

We sold out around 2am 12th December and ran a pre-validation later in the

day local time. The order creation pipeline ran 17th December am and

created additional orders.



Local team has started investigation in #in-58094-18-12-25 Slack channel.



The issue is impacting production in Sydney (planned for today) and Perth

(planned for tomorrow) If not addressed, delivery to customers (planned for

Monday 22nd December) will be impacted.



Thank you,

Tamas

Notes from ‚ÄúInfluencer MP: EOY Review‚Äù



These notes have been sent to invited guests in your organization.



Open meeting notes



The content was auto-generated on December 18, 2025, 5:03 PM CET and may  

contain errors.





Summary



Annette MvdE welcomed the team, including Katheryn Eckles, Sameer Doda,  

Nikita Gorshkov, and Marc, to review last year's research and plan for next  

year, focusing on ongoing customer and creator interviews. Katheryn Eckles  

shared that influencer interviews revealed positive creator interest, but  

strong demand for clear monetization structure, efficient low-effort recipe  

uploads (eg, automated nutrition facts), and enhanced filtering options on  

creator profiles, with concerns raised about the potential cost and time  

impact of the vetting process. Customer interviews showed high enthusiasm  

for the marketplace concept and a preference for low-commitment purchase  

models, emphasizing the need for creator trust established through verified  

badges, transparent reviews, and links to original social media videos.  

Someone in Megan Thee Scallion (Canada - Toronto HQ, 2) proposed  

integrating vetted creator recipes into HelloFresh's active meal selection  

for existing subscribers, suggesting that creators be paid every time their  

recipe ships, while Sameer Doda provided updates on scoping the MVP for the  

one-time purchase experience, leading to a recognized challenge regarding  

the sequencing of customer-facing versus creator-facing capabilities due to  

the supply-driven nature of the platform.





Suggested next steps





Katheryn Eckles will bring up the question about the format of the recipes  

in the final interview.



Sameer Doda will make changes and updates to the customer journey document,  

organize more sessions to gather insights, and present the end-to-end  

customer journey for the one-time purchase experience in the next session.



Sameer Doda will share updates on the scope of the MVP after the holidays.



Annette MvdE will add vacation dates to the shared document.

Why accessibility was prioritized



Prioritizing accessibility in our apps allows us to reach 1 in 4 adults in

the US <https://www.cdc.gov/media/releases/2024/s0716-Adult-disability.html>

and capture a share of the $140 billion

<https://www.nascio.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/NASCIO_The-Economic-Case-for-Digital-Accessibility_2025_a11y.pdf>

that Americans with disabilities spend annually on food and groceries

<https://www.ers.usda.gov/data-products/chart-gallery/chart-detail?chartId=76967>.

A good interface pays back with higher conversions.





Besides that, the European Accessibility Act (EAA), which mandates that

websites and mobile applications comply with the WCAG 2.2 Level AA

standard, came into effect on June 28, 2025. The directive applies to all

businesses in the EU, including HelloFresh and Factor. Non-compliance can

result in penalties such as fines (up to ‚Ç¨500K) or, in some countries like

Ireland, even 18 months of prison sentences.
